newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX Hub natgas called little changed with OTC.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX Hub natgas called little changed with OTC.

text.p: NYMEX Henry Hub natgas futures were expected to open little changed Monday morning, in line with early over-the-counter trade, industry sources said.
September OTC quotes this morning in the $2.43-2.435 area were straddling September future's close Friday at $2.432.

While traders said the screen may garner some support from the cash, which was still quoted above paper in the $2.50 area at Henry Hub, they said forecasts this week for fairly mild weather should temper the bulls.
Early Henry Hub cash quotes were down slightly from Friday.
"Nothing of any size (in the cash) has traded. People are playing it close to the vest this morning," said one trader.

Technical traders still pegged September resistance at $2.55 and then at the contract high and double top at $2.605. Further selling was likely in the $2.64-2.655 spot continuation chart gap from late January. Support was seen at Friday's low of $2.395, then at $2.34 and $2.30, with better buying likely in the $2.25-2.27 area.

In the cash Friday, Gulf Coast weekend prices slipped slightly to about the $2.50 level. Midcon pipes were steady to modestly lower in the low-$2.40s. New York city gate gas was little changed in the mid-$2.70s.
